q: I never dwell on what happened. You can't change it. Move forward.
h:
“I never dwell on what happened. You can't change it. Move forward.” —
Joan Rivers

q: Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.
h:
“Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.” —
Criss Jami

q: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
h:
“Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.
h:
“It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.” —
George Eliot

q: The final mystery is oneself.
h:
“The final mystery is oneself.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
h:
“I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.” —
Charles Darwin

q: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
h:
“The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: Cease striving. Then there will be transformation.
h:
“Cease striving. Then there will be transformation.” —
Zhuangzi

q: There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing.
h:
“There are no contests in the Art of Peace. A true warrior is invincible because he or she contests with nothing.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.
h:
“TEAMWORK: the fuel that allows common people attain uncommon results.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.
h:
“Every man gotta right to decide his own destiny.” —
Bob Marley

q: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
h:
“Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Children are our greatest natural resource.
h:
“Children are our greatest natural resource.” —
Herbert Hoover

q: We're responsible for everything that happens to us.
h:
“We're responsible for everything that happens to us.” —
Yanni

q: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
h:
“Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.
h:
“Good luck is opportunity meeting preparedness.” —
Deepak Chopra

q: Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.
h:
“Do not look upon this world with fear and loathing. Bravely face whatever the gods offer.” —
Morihei Ueshiba

q: I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.
h:
“I'm an optimist by choice not by stupidity.” —
Yanni

q: The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool.
h:
“The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: If you don't find the time, if you don't do the work, you don't get the results.
h:
“If you don't find the time, if you don't do the work, you don't get the results.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.
h:
“Fear does not have any special power unless you empower it by submitting to it.” —
Les Brown

q: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
h:
“Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
h:
“Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.” —
Winston Churchill

q: Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.
h:
“Why compare yourself with others? No one in the entire world can do a better job of being you than you.” —
Unknown

q: The key to success is failure.
h:
“The key to success is failure.” —
Michael Jordan

q: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
h:
“We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Life is a journey, not a destination.
h:
“Life is a journey, not a destination.” —
Dan Millman

q: The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.
h:
“The soul without imagination is what an observatory would be without a telescope.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
h:
“I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.
h:
“If someone betrays you once, it's their fault; if they betray you twice, it's your fault.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.
h:
“Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow ripening fruit.” —
Aristotle

q: an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure.
h:
“an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
h:
“Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
h:
“There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.” —
Epictetus

q: Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage.
h:
“Insanity is relative. It depends on who has who locked in what cage. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Failure is acceptable. Not trying is a whole different ball park.
h:
“Failure is acceptable. Not trying is a whole different ball park.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance
h:
“Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance” —
Honore de Balzac

q: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
h:
“There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?
h:
“Do you have the patience to wait until your mud settles and the water is clear?” —
Lao Tzu

q: Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.
h:
“Take care of your cents: dollars will take care of themselves.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: People inspire you, or they drain you. Pick them wisely.
h:
“People inspire you, or they drain you. Pick them wisely.” —
Les Brown

q: Perfectionism is simply putting a limit on your future.
h:
“Perfectionism is simply putting a limit on your future.” —
John Eliot

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.
h:
“Have the courage to follow your heart and intuition. They somehow know what you truly want to become.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Forever is composed of now's.
h:
“Forever is composed of now's.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.
h:
“Incredible change happens in your life when you decide to take control of what you do have power over instead of craving control over what you don't.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: A zen master's life is one continuous mistake.
h:
“A zen master's life is one continuous mistake.” —
Dogen

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.
h:
“Those who are possessed by nothing possess everything.” —
Morihei Ueshiba
